headline: News Corp Revenue Rises on Dow Jones, Digital Real Estate Results
summary: News Corp  reported revenue and profit increases for its fiscal first quarter, driven by growth at Dow Jones and the digital real estate divisions, which offset drops in the book publishing unit.  “We believe our shares are undervalued, given the sum of our valuable parts and our profit trajectory, and we will continue to focus on ways and means to maximize shareholder value,” Chief Executive  Robert Thomson  told analysts and investors Thursday.  The media company said revenue increased 2% to $2.1 billion for the first quarter, which ended Sept. 30, exceeding analyst expectations, according to FactSet.
